....HISTORY OF THE OLD AMERICANA PHOTOS

This image comes from the George Grantham Bain Collection which represents one of America's earliest news picture agencies. The collection richly documents sports events, theater, celebrities, crime, strikes, disasters, political activities including the woman suffrage campaign, conventions and public celebrations. The photographs Bain produced and gathered for distribution through his news service were worldwide in their coverage, but there was a special emphasis on life in New York City. The bulk of the collection dates from the 1900s to the mid-1920s, but scattered images can be found as early as the 1860s and as late as the 1930s. (Library of Congress)....

If we can have a short descrption of each photo introduce the name of event and little background story about the people inside each photo that really is a good education to viewers today who did not know anything about 1900 in the world but can see the history being brought to life.

The historical photos are valuable assets.

comment._content: Helen Gould's home was Lyndhurst, at Tarrytown, NY, seen in this Bain Collection photo. The photo above appears to have been taken in the porte-cochère seen at right in the Lyndhurst photo. Frank Jay Gould (1877-1956) was Helen Gould's youngest brother. The Mrs. Gould in this photo is Frank's second wife, the former Edith Kelly, an actress he married in 1910. They were divorced in 1919.
